intro: Clermontia arborescens subsp. arborescens, commonly known as the tree clermonthe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red and bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests.
